results.title: I dream of peace and rest: Norman Lindsay
results.brief_description: The opening of Norman Lindsay’s house by the National Trust. The house exhibits work by Norman Lindsay, including sculpture in the gardens. Lindsay’s thoughts and reflections on his life and work are heard, and many of his works of art are shown. Narrated by Margaret Throsby and Don Reid.

results.title: I am Tom Moody
results.brief_description:
As the performer steps up to the microphone, will the desire to make music be defeated by fears of failure and feelings of inadequacy? The awful solitude of the spotlight forces Tom to confront his inner critic.
Written, directed and animated by Ainslie Henderson.
Voices: Mackenzie Crook, Jude Crook, Rick Webster
Music: Peter Deane
Compositing: Will Anderson
Sound design: Ainslie Henderson, Joe Acheson

results.title: I am Joe's spine
results.brief_description: Uses three-dimensional animation and live sequences to provide an understanding of the complexity of the spine’s construction and an awareness of what can happen when the spine and its surrounding muscles are not given proper care.

results.title: I am Joe's heart
results.brief_description: While the camera follows Joe through a typical American business man’s day, his heart speaks out about what Joe is doing to it. Animation in a machinery metaphor illustrates the heart’s functions and the effects upon it of anxiety, tension, smoking, faulty diet and overweight. Joe’s heart attack and a coronary shutdown are detailed along with the step-by-step lifesaving procedures in an Intensive Care Unit. While Joe’s recovery lessens the fear of the fatality of a heart attack his experience brings home a lesson that can prevent heart attacks from happening.

results.title: I am here today (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A record of how 21 children aged 5, 6 and 7 interacted with each other as they made various things in the playroom. The children were from the same class, growing and changing together in the classroom since the previous September. Filmed in May 1969. A film study for teachers.

results.title: I'm still a woman
results.creator_credit: Joyce Mann and Joyce Mann Productions
results.brief_description: Three weeks before her wedding, Mrs Joyce Mann discovered that she had a lump in her breast. After a mastectomy she and her husband found just how few facilities there were for women who were considered mutilated. Before a group of nurses, Mrs Mann explains and demonstrates her experience, and the underwear she has worn and now wears. Another cancer victim shows that now, at times breasts can be reconstructed.
